entries.name: Age
entries: Flameveil reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Flameveil society, with its clear devotion to their deity, has a strong lawful bent. Because of their isolation, they tend to lean more toward neutral.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Bonded With Flame
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Flame Body
entries: When you would take a non-magic weapon attack, as a reaction you can roll a Dexterity saving throw with a DC of 8 + the enemy's hit modifier. If you succeed, you take no damage from that attack. You can use this trait twice, and afterwards, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Candle in the Dark
entries: You appear to be surrounded by a soft flickering candlelight that extends outwards 30 feet in all directions. As a bonus action, you can smother your flames and allow them to dim.

entries.name: Heritage of the Flameveil
entries: You know the {@spell produce flame} cantrip.

entries.name: Final Light
entries: Upon reaching zero hit points, your body becomes one with the Plane of Fire, and you explode into a fiery storm. Each hostile creature in a 30 feet radius must make a Dexterity saving throw equal to your 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus. On a failed save, they take {@dice 1d8} fire damage. For every level above 1, add an additional {@dice 1d8} fire damage. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Ignan.

entries.name: Age
entries: Kitsune mature slowly, achieving adulthood at 20 and living up to 300 with only one tail.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Born in the epicenter of Yonia between the mortal plane and the spiritual plane, Kitsune adhere mostly to a neutral alignment. Some will align with humanity, and awaken a spark of good, while others align with the darkness and become Nogitsune.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium when in human form. In fox form, your size is Small.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have advantage on {@skill Perception} checks pertaining to scent or hearing.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Fey in origin, Kitsune can see in dim light within 60 feet as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim. You cannot discern color in darkness, only in shades of gray.

entries.name: The Nine Tailed Path
entries: Kitsune begin with a single fox tail generally 3 feet long. At 4th level and every 2 levels afterwards, you grow an additional tail as you grow in worldly experience. Each tail you possess increases your lifespan by 100 years. Tails which are cut off or otherwise removed do not grow back naturally but may be restored by use of the {@spell Regenerate} spell. This does not affect the years gained in extended life if a tail is removed.

entries.name: Shapeshift
entries: You can transform between fox form and human form at will. In combat it takes an action. You may speak in this form but you cannot cast magic other than Kitsune Magic. Opposed to changing shape, you can choose to instead hide your ears and tail(s) to appear human completely and acts like the alter self spell. As a fox, you get one attack with Bite or Claw (your choice) as natural Dexterity based attack. Subrace element damage replaces slashing damage on Claw.

entries.name: Slash and Maul
entries: You are proficient with your unarmed strikes. When you make an unarmed attack, decide whether you're attacking with your claws or your bite. Your claws deal {@dice 1d4} slashing damage on a hit, whereas your bite deals {@dice 1d6} piercing damage.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Sylvan, and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: First Clan of Flame
entries: Your unarmed claw attacks now deal {@dice 1d4} fire damage.

entries.name: Kistune Magic
entries: You know the {@spell fire bolt} cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Charming
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Performance} skill.

entries.name: Second Clan of Ice
entries: Your unarmed claw attacks now deal {@dice 1d4} ice damage.

entries.name: Kistune Magic
entries: You know the {@spell frostbite} cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Detective
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Investigation} skill.

entries.name: Third Clan of the Moon
entries: Your unarmed claw attacks now deal {@dice 1d4} radiant damage.

entries.name: Kistune Magic
entries: You know the {@spell sacred flame} cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Vigilant
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Fourth Clan of the Mist
entries: Your unarmed claw attacks now deal {@dice 1d4} thunder damage.

entries.name: Kistune Magic
entries: You know the {@spell booming blade} cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Assailant
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} skill.

entries.name: Fifth Clan of Shadow
entries: Your unarmed claw attacks now deal {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage.

entries.name: Kistune Magic
entries: You no longer maintain the ability to cast Kitsune Magic.

entries.name: Born From Beast
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

entries.name: Frightening Presence
entries: While in your natural fox form, your size is Medium instead of Small. Your eyes turn red and your fur turns a charred ashen black. As a bonus action, you can emit an aura of fear within a 10-foot radius for 1 minute. Any creature entering that aura must make a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you. The DC for this ability is 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus.

Your opponent may make another saving throw at the end of their next turn. On a success, they are no longer frightened, and are immune to your aura for 24 hours. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Age
entries: Revenant do not age. Given time, the necromantic energies that sustain you will heal most wounds you take at approximately the same rate as a mortal, and your hit die function as normal.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Many Revenants cling to the alignment they held in their life, even if that life is but a distant memory in their minds. For others, the act of being swallowed by the Rift changes them drastically, and they adopt a new world view in light of what Shao has taught them.

entries.name: Past Life
entries: Choose another race besides this one; the race you select must be humanoid and lack the Living Construct trait (or similar). Even after being swallowed by the Rift, you maintain vague memories of this past life as this race. Your size, height, and movement speed are the same as this race. You do not retain special movement speeds from this race (such as flying, climbing, or swimming), and you do not carry over any racial features. If your past race had subraces, select one, but you do not carry over any racial features from that either.

entries.name: Living Dead
entries: You have been brought back from the Rift, but your form has changed drastically. You are immune to disease. You do not need to eat or breathe, but you can ingest food and drink if you wish. Additionally, you have two creature types: humanoid and undead. You can be affected by a spell or ability that works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Onward to Salvation
entries: Escaping the Rift was no easy feat, and your new undead body assisted you in this endeavor. As an undead, you rarely tire. You treat exhaustion as if it was one level less. In addition, instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day. You do not dream in this state; you are fully aware of your surroundings and notice approaching enemies and other events as normal.

entries.name: Unholy Gospel
entries: After breaking out of the Rift, you received a blessing known colloquially as a gospel. Unlike other undead, you can be restored through healing magic, but it has a significantly dampened effect on you. When you regain hit points from a source that specifies it does not function on undead, you instead receive half as many hit points as the source would provide, rounded down, instead of none.

entries.name: Eternal Vengeance
entries: The presence of those who reside in the Rift registers on the senses like a noxious odor. As an action, you can open your awareness to detect such creatures. Until the end of your next turn, you know the location of any beings who originated from the Rift Plane within 60 feet of you that is not behind total cover. You can use this feature a number of times equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier. When you finish a long rest, you regain all expended uses.

entries.name: Driven
entries: You have advantage on saving throws that would turn undead or would cause you to be {@condition Frightened}.

entries.name: Resurrection Beyond Death
entries: When you drop to 0 hit points, you can choose to stay conscious instead of falling unconscious. If you do, gain temporary hit points equal to your total character level + your Constitution modifier (minimum 1), which lasts for up to 1 minute.

In this state, you can take an action or a bonus action on your turn, but not both, and can move up to only half your movement speed. You remain in this state until you regain hit points, or until you no longer have temporary hit points. If you lose all temporary hit points in this state while you are at 0 hit points, you fall unconscious and begin making death saving throws as normal. Once you use this trait, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and two other languages of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Skeletons do not age in the traditional sense, but they do decay over time. The necromantic energies that sustain you will heal most wounds you take at approximately the same rate as a mortal, and your hit die function as normal. A skeleton will generally live up to a maximum of two hundred years, at which their soul will be absorbed back into the Rift Plane to be reincarnated once more.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: An outcast in even minority socieites, the Skeleton is not without its fair share of natural enemies. In order to survive, they inclined to start a nation all of their own. Because to this, they tend to share a lawful bent. Apart from that, their inclination towards good or evil is not stagnant. The best and worst live among their numbers.

entries.name: Past Life
entries: Choose another race besides this one; the race you select must be humanoid and lack the Living Construct trait (or similar). Even after becoming a Wraith (and later a Skeleton), you maintain vague memories of this past life as this race. Your size, height, and movement speed are the same as this race. You do not retain special movement speeds from this race (such as flying, climbing, or swimming), and you do not carry over any racial features. If your past race had subraces, select one, but you do not carry over any racial features from that either.

entries.name: Living Dead
entries: As the offspring of the Rift Plane and a nonsentient Wraith, Skeletons are gifted with supernatural properties. You are immune to disease. You do not need to eat or breathe, but you can ingest food and drink if you wish. Additionally, you have two creature types: humanoid and undead. You can be affected by a spell or ability that works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Onward to Salvation
entries: With no pulse to drive you and no veins to pump blood, your body must be designed to operate at its maximum capacity almost always. As an undead, you rarely tire. You treat exhaustion as if it was one level less. In addition, instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day. You do not dream in this state; you are fully aware of your surroundings and notice approaching enemies and other events as normal.

entries.name: Curse of the Undead
entries: A tragic fate lies the souls of the damned. With no life force contained within their souls, an unfortunate majority of Skeletons meet a tragic fate while on the battlefield. Like most undead, healing effects that state they do not work on undead have no effect on you.

entries.name: Collapse
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do, reduce yourself to a pile of bones and render yourself prone. You are considered to be under similar effects to the feign death spell. While subject to this condition, you are unable to move or take actions other than using an action to end this effect. Once you use this trait, you are unable to use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Them Bones
entries: If both your hands are unoccupied, you can use a bonus action to rearrange your skeletal structure, or return your body to its original configuration. When you rearrange your bones, choose one of the following options, any of which are considered to occupy both of your hands:

• You remove an arm and use it as a bone club. While used as a weapon, you have proficiency with your removed arm, which is a melee weapon with the finesse property that deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage on it. This weapon also has the light property, but for all intents and purposes, that fact is of little use.

• You remove a hand and hold it in your other as if it were a set of thieves' tools. This hand is capable of manipulating locks through picking, cutting glass, and any other function a normal set of thieves' tools could achieve.

• You remove two of your ribs and use the rest of them as a musical instrument. This instrument is referred to as the Bone Xylophone, and while playing you gain advantage on Performance checks meant to entertain children.
• You gain pull out several of your bones in an attempt to juggle them.
• You can remove your skull from its socket and use your arm to look around walls.
Your bones lose their animation if they are further than 5-feet away from your main body. If your skull loses animation, you are blinded and deafened until a skull is reaffixed to your body.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and two other languages of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: After receiving a Mark from Ryder, the Lesser Deity of the Forge, Humans tend to manifest a lawful nature, even under less than ideal nuturing conditions.

entries.name: Artisan's Intuition
entries: When you make an {@skill Arcana} check or an ability check involving artisan's tools, you can roll a {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Ryder's Gift
entries: You gain proficiency with one type of artisan's tools of your choice.

entries.name: Spellsmith
entries: You know the {@spell mending} cantrip. You can also cast the magic weapon spell with this trait. When you do so, the spell lasts for 1 hour and doesn't require concentration. Once you cast the spell with this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: After receiving a Mark from Brykal, the Lesser Deity of the Shield, Humans tend to manifest a good nature, even under less than ideal nuturing conditions.

entries.name: Sentinel's Intuition
entries: When you make an {@skill Insight} or {@skill Perception} check, you can roll a {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Guardian's Shield
entries: You can cast the {@spell shield} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to cast it after you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Vigilant
entries: When a creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to swap places with that creature, and you are hit by the attack instead. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Bound by the Duel
entries: You can cast the {@spell compelled duel} spell with this trait. Once you cast the spell with this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: After receiving a Mark from Yui, the Lesser Deity of the Hunt, Humans tend bend towards being chaotic. They also tend to manifest a good nature, even under less than ideal nuturing conditions.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Hunter's Intuition
entries: When you make a {@skill Perception} or {@skill Survival} check, you can roll a {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Finder's Magic
entries: You can cast the {@spell hunter's mark} spell with this trait. Starting at 3rd level, you can also cast the {@spell locate object} spell with it. Once you cast either spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: After receiving a Mark from Bane, the Lesser Guardian of the Forest, Humans tend bend towards a feeling of neutrality. They also tend to have a greater respect for wildlife.

entries.name: Wild Intuition
entries: When you make a {@skill Animal Handling} or {@skill Nature} check, you can roll a {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Primal Connection
entries: You can cast the {@spell animal friendship} and {@spell speak with animals} spells with this trait, requiring no material component. Once you cast either spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a short or long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: The Bigger They Are
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can target a beast or monstrosity when you cast {@spell animal friendship} or {@spell speak with animals}, provided the creature's Intelligence score is 3 or lower.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: After receiving a Mark from Neon, the Greater Guardian of Time, Humans tend bend towards a feeling of neutrality. They also tend to be more punctual and pertinent when receiving orders.

entries.name: Gait of Time
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Intuitive Motion
entries: When you make an {@skill Acrobatics} check or any ability check to operate or maintain a land vehicle, you can roll a {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Magical Passage
entries: You can cast the {@spell misty step} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Dexterity is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Humans tend toward no particular alignment. The best and the worst are found among them.

entries.name: Size
entries: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed Step
entries: In combat, you can use a bonus action to immediately gain the benefits of the Dash action. You can only use this trait once per long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Age
entries: Orcs reach adulthood at age 12 and live up to 50 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The orcs of Kagreth are a passionate people, given to powerful emotion and deep faith. They are generally chaotic, but can be any alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Orcs are usually over 6 feet tall and weigh between 230 and 280 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, you can move up to your movement speed toward a hostile creature you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

entries.name: Menacing
entries: You are trained in the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Savage Dissonance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points, before you fall unconscious, you can use your reaction to make one melee attack against a creature within melee range. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Orc.

entries.name: Age
entries: Dhampirs mature at the same rate as humans, but can live for centuries.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Dhampirs might not have an innate tendency toward evil, but many end up there. They are typically neutral.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dhampirs are the same size and build as humans. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Vampiric Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against diseases and being {@condition Charmed}.

entries.name: Undead Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Fangs
entries: You have fangs like a vampire. They are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Blood Drinker
entries: As an action, you can make a special attack with your fangs. If the attack hits, you deal necrotic damage instead of piercing damage, and you heal hit points (minimum of 1) equal to your Constitution modifier, and you can’t use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and another language of your choice.

entries.name: Kin of Mine
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} and {@skill Stealth} skills.

entries.name: Misty Escape
entries: As a reaction to taking damage, you can create a 20-foot-radius sphere of fog centered on you. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for one minute or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your heritage, you have first-rate vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Unncanny Climber
entries: You have advantage on any {@skill Athletics} check made to climb difficult surfaces.

entries.name: Dark Hopsitality
entries: You have proficiency in one of the following skills: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Persuasion}.

entries.name: Vampiric Charm
entries: You can cast {@spell charm person} with this trait, using Charisma as your spellcasting ability for it. Once you cast it, you can’t cast it again with this trait until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your heritage, you have first-rate vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Vermin Speech
entries: You can cast {@spell animal friendship} an unlimited number of times with this trait, but you can target only bats, rats, and wolves with it. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries: If you aren't in sunlight, you can use your action to cast polymorph on yourself to transform into a bat, rat, or wolf. When cast in this way, polymorph requires no components and cannot be dispelled. It has the following changes:

• Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the beast, but you retain your alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. If the creature has the same proficiency as you and the bonus in its stat block is higher than yours, use the creature’s bonus instead of yours.

• You retain the benefit of any features from your class, race, or other source and can use them if the new form is physically capable of doing so. However, you can’t use any of your special senses, such as darkvision, unless your new form also has that sense.
Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Age
entries: All Vespids reach maturity at 12, beyond this workers live about as long as 75 years, drones as long as 350 years, and workers that become queens can live as long as 750 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Vespidan societies are invariably highly structured and caste-based. They are almost always strongly lawful and usually lawful neutral as the good of the hive supersedes all other concerns. The exception are the hive- broken who are still often lawful by upbringing, but can easily stray into any form of thinking from there.

entries.name: Size
entries: Workers and Drones are small sized, while Queens are medium sized.

entries.name: Multiarmed
entries: All Vespids are born with 4 arms. Your two additional arms allow you to interact with an additional object or feature of the environment for free on your turn. You may not carry and use shields for defense with these additional arms. Nor do they grant you additional attacks, or allow you to wield weapons with them for combat.

entries.name: Flight
entries: As part of a move action, a Vespidan can instead fly 30 feet, but must end their movement on the ground or a solid surface. A Vespidan who ends its turn in the air immediately plummets to the ground. To use this speed you can't be wearing heavy armor or be encumbered.

entries.name: Carapace
entries: Your Carapace provides limited protection, and makes you accustomed to wearing armor. You can calculate your base AC as 11 + your Dexterity modifier while not wearing armor, and a shield’s benefits apply as normal while you use this AC. While wearing medium armor, your maximum Dexterity modifier bonus is increased by 1.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish.

entries.name: Inspiring Queen
entries: You may use the Help action as a bonus action, for a number of times equal to your Proficiency bonus. You regain the ability to use the Help action this way after finishing a short or long rest. At level 3, when you use the Help action to aid an ally in attacking a creature, the target of that attack can be within 30 feet of you, rather than within 5 feet of you. Should the ally already have advantage, then it may add half your proficiency bonus (rounded up) to the attack's hit and damage roll instead.

entries.name: Sting
entries: Your sting is a natural weapon, which you can use to 4 make a unarmed strike with. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. On a hit, you may choose to inject the target with your venom, after which you must spend a long rest before you can use your venom again.

This venom causes the target to take {@dice 2d6} poison damage, and it must make a Constitution saving throw (DC: 10 + your Proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier). On a failed save, it is also {@condition Poisoned} until the start of your next turn. The poison damage increases to 3d6 at 5th level. 4d6 at 10th level, 5d6 at 15th level, and 6d6 at 20th level.

entries.name: Insightful Monarch
entries: You have proficiency in the Insight skill, and advantage on saving throws to avoid being charmed.

entries.name: Swarm Tactics
entries: You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated. You may only benefit from this trait once per turn.

entries.name: Sting
entries: Your sting is a natural weapon, which you can use to 4 make a unarmed strike with. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. On a hit, you may choose to inject the target with your venom, after which you must spend a long rest before you can use your venom again.

This venom causes the target to take {@dice 2d6} poison damage, and it must make a Constitution saving throw (DC: 10 + your Proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier). On a failed save, it is also {@condition Poisoned} until the start of your next turn. The poison damage increases to 3d6 at 5th level. 4d6 at 10th level, 5d6 at 15th level, and 6d6 at 20th level.

entries.name: Talented Builder
entries: You have proficiency in one Tool of your choice. In addition, you learn new Tool proficiencies in half the normal amount of downtime weeks, rounded down. This reduction is applied last, after any reduction you may receive from your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Magic Savant
entries: After finishing a short or long rest you may choose one of the following spells: {@spell animal friendship}, {@spell misty step}, or {@spell shield}. You may cast this chosen spell once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to choose and cast a spell in this manner after finishing a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Harmonic Casting
entries: When you cast a non-cantrip spell you may channel some of the magic into yourself or a creature you can see within 60 feet. The chosen creature gains temporary hit points equal to the spell's level plus your proficiency bonus. Creatures may only be affected by this trait once, after which they may be affected again after they finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Gregarious
entries: You have proficiency in the Persuasion skill. Giant Wasps that are {@condition Charmed} by you will actively protect and fight for you.

entries.name: Age
entries: A typical warforged is between two and thirty years old. The maximum warforged lifespan remains a mystery; so far, warforged have shown no signs of deterioration due to age. You are immune to magical aging effects.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most warforged take comfort in order and discipline, tending toward law and neutrality. But some have absorbed the morality, or lack thereof, of the beings with which they served.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being @condition Poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You don't need to sleep and don't suffer the effects of {@condition Exhaustion} due to lack of rest, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Sentry's Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours of it in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you {@condition unconscious}, and you can see and hear as normal.

entries.name: Integrated Protection
entries: Your body has built-in defensive layers, which can be enhanced with armor:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class.

You can don only armor with which you have proficiency. To don armor, you must incorporate it into your body over the course of 1 hour, during which you remain in contact with the armor. To doff armor, you must spend 1 hour removing it. You can rest while donning or doffing armor in this way.
While you live, your armor can't be removed from your body against your will.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common.

entries.name: Specialized Design
entries: You gain one skill proficiency of your choice, one {@book tool|phb|5|tools} proficiency of your choice, and fluency in one language of your choice.
In addition, if you do not already know it, you learn to speak Neural.

entries.name: Integrated Tool
entries: Choose one tool you're proficient with. This tool is integrated into your body, and you double your proficiency bonus for any ability checks you make with it. You must have your hands free to use this integrated tool.

entries.name: Iron Fists
entries: When you hit with an unarmed strike, you can deal {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage, instead of the normal damage for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Swift
entries: Your walking speed increases by 5 feet.

entries.name: Light Step
entries: When you are traveling alone for an extended period of time (one hour or more), you can move stealthily at a normal pace. (See chapter 8 of the Player's Handbook for information about travel pace.)

entries.name: Age
entries: Toran grow up very fast, and live very long lives. Torans reach adulthood at age 13. On average, they live about 300 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: As part of a move action, a Toran can instead fly 40 feet, but must end their movement on the ground or a solid surface. A Toran who ends its turn in the air immediately plummets to the ground. To use this speed you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

entries.name: Size
entries: Toran are between 2 to 3 feet tall and average about 30 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Picking Claws
entries: Torans don't have hands, but their claws are dextrous enough to handle small complex tasks. Toran can pick up weapons but can't use them in combat.

entries.name: Flight
entries: You gain a flying speed of 40 feet while you aren't wearing medium or heavy armor. You fall if you end your turn in the air.

entries.name: Song & Dance
entries: You have proficiency with your claws, which are a finesse weapon dealing {@dice 1d8} slashing damage.

entries.name: Dazzling Plummage
entries: As a bonus action you can double your proficiency bonus on any Charisma skill check. After using this ability you can't use it again until after a short rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Toran, and Auran.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-Nasods age at virtually the same rate as Humans, although they live a bit longer, with the oldest of them being around one-hundred and thirty years old.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Half-Nasods tend toward no particular alignment. The best and the worst are found among them.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Nasods vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Designed with Speed in Mind
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Obscuring Gaze
entries: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Energy Weapon
entries: You can use your bonus action to construct a beam of destructive energy centered around your weapon. On your next successful melee weapon attack, target creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes an additional {@dice 2d6} radiant damage and is {@condition Poisoned} until the end of your next turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Neural.

entries.name: Age
entries: With the proper replacement parts and activities to occupy yourself, you can conceivably exist indefinitely. Nasods are known to degrade and lose their sanity, however, if they live too long without an explicit purpose. It is not known if this insanity visits all Nasods at old age, or just those whose resolve wavers.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Nasods possess mechanical minds, which find logic comforting. Generally, Nasods are lawful.

entries.name: Size
entries: As constructs modified by self-aware machines, Nasods could conceivably be perfectly uniform, like the Warforged that preceded them. However, the Foundries are either inherently flawed, or otherwise have a fondness for making diverse units, for each created Nasod is in some way unique. Nasod units stand between 5 and 7 feet tall and average about 150 to 300 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Created by Code
entries: Even though you were constructed, you are a living creature, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition Poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.

Instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day. You do not dream in this state; you are fully aware of your surroundings and notice approaching enemies and other events as normal.
You can still be placed into a torpor by sleep-inducing magic.

entries.name: Thermal Vision
entries: Equipped with a heat-detecting thermal vision system beneath your eyelids, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades reprentative of thermal vision.

entries.name: Mind Over Matter
entries: Your mechanical mind is inherently logical, and is not easily swayed. You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition Charmed}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Neural.

entries.name: Made to Assemble
entries: You gain one skill proficiency of your choice and one {@book tool|phb|5|tools} proficiency of your choice.

entries.name: On the Line
entries: You know the {@spell mending} cantrip. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: It's Just Anti-Freeze
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Autonomous Blaster Device
entries: You can cast the {@spell magic missile} spell as a 2nd-level spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: From the Oceans
entries: You gain a swimming speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Neural Synapses
entries: Using gestures and sounds, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts that have an inborn swimming speed.

entries.name: Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Aquan.

entries.name: Age
entries: Panda mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most Panda are lawful, believing firmly in the benefits of a well-ordered society. They tend toward good as well, with a strong sense of fair play and a belief that everyone deserves to share in the benefits of a just order.

entries.name: Size
entries: Panda are between 7 feet to 8 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: You have advantage on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Natural Healer
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Medicine} skill.

entries.name: Between Worlds
entries: Panda are considered humanoids and beasts for the purpose of calculating effects which take into account creature type. You can be affected by a game effect if it works on either of your creature types. You also ignore the effects of difficult terrain while in heavily-forested terrain.

entries.name: Gourmand
entries: Panda are excellent cooks and brewers. You are proficient in the cook's utensils and brewer's supplies.

entries.name: Sagely Knowledge
entries: You can cast {@spell comprehend languages} as a ritual. This is not represented as innate spellcasting, but rather as a Panda's incredible knowledge that spans all languages. However, due to this vast amount of knowledge, it is difficult for them to remember all the languages kept in their mind's archive, leading to forgetfulness.
In addition, when casting Comprehend Languages this way, you also learn to speak those languages for the duration of the spell.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.

entries.name: Age
entries: Ursa mature at the same rate humans do and reach adulthood around the age of 20. They live much longer than humans, however, often exceeding 180 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Ursa have a lawful bent, seeking the value of freedom in laws. In the tribal parts of Kagreth, all Ursa have their part to play in the tribe.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Prowler of the Seas
entries: Ursa find it difficult to walk upright, and as such tend to move on all fours. While moving like this, an Ursa's base walking speed is 35 instead of 20.

entries.name: Blessing of Ai'shae
entries: Ursa have been blessed by Ai'shae to channel the elemental properties of water even while traversing land. Ursa can tap into this power to begin swimming through the air, which acts as a flying speed of 20. An Ursa who ends its turn in the air immediately plummets to the ground. To use this speed you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

entries.name: Load of the Lands
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: On the Hunt
entries: You have advantage on {@skill Perception} checks which rely on smell, but have disadvantage on {@skill Perception} checks which rely on sight.

entries.name: Claws of the Winter Winds
entries: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Aquan.

entries.name: Age
entries: Saki live long lives. They enter adulthood in their late teens and usually live to be about two centuries.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Saki society, with its clear roles and tasks, has a strong lawful bent. The Saki's sense of fairness, balanced with a strict code of conduct, leans them more towards good.

entries.name: Size
entries: Saki are between 7 and 9 feet tall and weigh between 300 and 400 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Hearty Fortitude
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} skill.

entries.name: Rock Hurler
entries: You are considered proficient in the use of appropriately-sized rocks and boulders as ranged weapons. Such boulders typically weigh fifty pounds, and deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d10} + your Strength modifier, and have the thrown (30/150) and heavy qualities.

entries.name: Mountain Born
entries: You’re acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet. You’re also naturally adapted to cold climates.

entries.name: Door Opener
entries: You learn the {@skill mold earth} cantrip, and are skilled at using it to modify doorways to allow for your larger build. You can repair the doorway afterward without expending an action.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Giant.

entries.name: Dusk Study
entries: Scholars have hardened their minds to resist the calls of slumber. While taking a long rest, you can spend half of that time doing any studious activity, including reading and writing.

entries.name: Path of Knowledge
entries: When attempting to recall information about a particular city, kingdom, or culture, you are considered proficient in History, and add double your proficiency to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write one additional language.

entries.name: Savage Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

entries.name: War Born
entries: You gain proficiency in two martial weapons of your choice.

entries.name: Savage Dissonance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points, before you fall unconscious, you can use your reaction to make one melee attack against a creature within melee range. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Cook at the Hill
entries: You gain proficiency with cook’s utensils.

entries.name: Exotic Ingredients
entries: Whenever you prepare a meal for your party, provided you have cook’s utensils and other supplies on hand, you can use a variety of strange ingredients.

entries.name: Keen Nose
entries: You have advantage on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: As Hard as His Axe
entries: As an Executioner, you've seen it all, and you don't care. You no longer feel non-magical fear.

entries.name: Exotic Weaponry
entries: You are proficient in the use of nets.

entries.name: It's Me or You
entries: You loathe to let a criminal escape your grasp. Whenever you would make an attack of opportunity, you can gain advantage on that attack. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Divine Prophet
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill Religon}.

entries.name: Blood of Alu'kuri
entries: Your Rock Hurler now allows you to use boulders over one hundred pounds as ranged weapons. You deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d12} + your Strength modifier. Boulders below a hundred pounds do not gain the benefit of this trait.

entries.name: Choba Choba
entries: You can tap into your divine sense to see future events once per long rest. These visions can be sporadic, and typically have little context.

entries.name: Hands of Alu'kuri
entries: You learn the {@spell mage hand} cantrip. When used, it appears as a long, mechanical red hand, symbolic of the blood-soaked weapon that Alu'kuri has become in the eyes of the lowlanders.

entries.name: Age
entries: Ghosts do not age. Given time, the necromantic energies that sustain you will heal most wounds you take at approximately the same rate as a mortal, and your hit die function as normal.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Many Ghosts cling to the alignment they held in their life, even if that life is but a distant memory in their minds. For others, the act of being reborn as a ghastly entity on the mortal coil changes them significantly, and they adopt a new worldview in light of what their transformation has taught them.

entries.name: Past Life
entries: Choose another race besides this one; the race you select must be humanoid and lack the Living Construct trait (or similar). Even after being transformed in the Ethereal Plane, you maintain vague memories of this past life as this race. Your size, height, and movement speed are the same as this race. You do not retain special movement speeds from this race (such as flying, climbing, or swimming), and you do not carry over any racial features. If your past race had subraces, select one, but you do not carry over any racial features from that either.

entries.name: Living Dead
entries: You have been brought back to the mortal coil, but your form has changed drastically. You are immune to disease. You do not need to eat or breathe, but you can ingest food and drink if you wish. Additionally, you have two creature types: humanoid and undead. You can be affected by a spell or ability that works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Holy Gospel
entries: After reviving in the Material Plane, you received a blessing through a deitic force. This force is not any specific deity or person, but rather a force of nature similar to a tornado or hurricane. Unlike other undead, you can be restored through healing magic, but it has a significantly dampened effect on you. When you regain hit points from a source that specifies it does not function on undead, you instead receive half as many hit points as the source would provide, rounded down, instead of none.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and two other languages of your choice.

entries.name: Flight
entries: You gain a flying speed of 20 feet. When using your flying speed, you cannot end your turn more than 5 feet above a solid surface, and gently descend down to this distance at a speed of 60 feet per round if you are any higher.

entries.name: Deitic Force
entries: Your unarmed strikes deal radiant or necrotic damage (your choice) instead of bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Incorporeal Stride
entries: You can move through other creatures and objects other than physical barriers (such as walls, floors, or ceilings) as if they were difficult terrain. On your turn, you can pass through up to 10 feet of physical barriers (treating them as difficult terrain) as a part of your movement. If you end your turn inside an object or barrier, you take 1d10 force damage and are immediately ejected to the closest available space. After passing through a physical barrier, you must complete a short or long rest before you are able to do so again.

entries.name: Intangible
entries: You have advantage on all checks to resist or escape a grapple.

entries.name: Invoke Smite
entries: You can instill power into the weapon of a nearby creature to strike with divine energy. As an action, a creature within 30 feet of you.

Until the end of your next turn, the next time that creature succeeds on a melee weapon attack, it deals an additional 1d8 radiant damage (if you are good or neutral) or 1d8 necrotic damage (if you are evil). Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Spirit Binding
entries: As a Spirit, your ghastly form is not completely realized, and require an anchor to maintain your existence in the Material Plane. You must select an object or creature of your choice (it could be a heirloom, weapon, or ally) to bind to indefinitely.
• You must remain within 150 feet of your bound target at all times, and if the object leaves your 150 foot radius, you are dragged along with it.
• You are always aware of where your bound target is in relation to you.
• Should the object be destroyed or the creature slain, you immediately drop to 0 hit points.

• If you regain consciousness without a spirit bond, you must immediately select a new object or creature within 150 feet to bind to. If no items or creatures are present within 150 feet, you are paralyzed until one comes within 150 feet of you.

entries.name: Incorporeal Stride
entries: You can move through other creatures and objects other than physical barriers (such as walls, floors, or ceilings) as if they were difficult terrain. On your turn, you can pass through up to 10 feet of physical barriers (treating them as difficult terrain) as a part of your movement. If you end your turn inside an object or barrier, you take 1d10 force damage and are immediately ejected to the closest available space. After passing through a physical barrier, you must complete a short or long rest before you are able to do so again.

entries.name: Ethereal Glare
entries: As a bonus action, choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. This creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against a DC of 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus. If it fails, this creature becomes frightened of you until the end of your next turn. Once you use this ability successfully, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: Canopic Chamber
entries: Chained to your soul is your physical body, which lies dormant in a sacrophagus until the time of your True Resurrection. This sacrophagus is located on the Ethereal Plane, and follows you within a 50 foot radius as you move along the Material Plane. Your body remaining alive is what allows your soul to reflect against the Material Plane as a humanoid shell for your actions.

If at any point your real body is destroyed, with the result making it so you are unable to sustain your continued existence, you soul immediately vanishes from the Material Plane. Following that, you immediately take Aeon damage equal to your maximum hit points (including temporary hit points), and your cease to remain within the collective conscious of humanity.

During a period of one hundred years after this event, memories of your existence will slowly begin to disappear from the minds of even your closest comrades, until eventually your life is completely wiped from annals of all non-magical storage.
• Your sacrophagus is bound to the Ethereal Plane by a deitic force and cannot be moved to a separate plane by any means.
• Your sacrophagus is locked shut by ethereal chains, although they can be opened with a DC 25 thieves' tools check.
• If your sacrophagus is unlocked, taking a short rest will relock it. This is represented by the ethereal chains needing time to reform.
• Your sacrophagus has an AC of 18 and hit points equal to a quarter of your maximum hit points.
• Any saving throws your true body or your sacrophagus makes are flat 1d20s.
• Your true body has an AC equal to 10 and hit points equal to your current maximum.
• Spells such as True Resurrection and Clone can only be cast on the body within your sacrophagus, and not your soul on the Material Plane.
• Your body within the sacrophagus is unconscious, but it is also immune to the following conditions: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained.
• No matter what plane you are on, you are aware if your true body is being attacked (but not if your sacrophagus is).
• Your true body cannot be separated from your sarcophagus.

entries.name: Canopic Resurrection
entries: While your soul is reflected against the Material Plane, your actual body resides on the Ethereal Plane. While your body remains safe and within its sarcophagus, you can reroll one death saving throw you have made. If you roll a 17 or higher on this rerolled saving throw, treat the result as if it was a natural 20. Once you reroll this saving throw, you must finish a short or long rest before you can do so again.

entries.name: Grasp from Beyond
entries: You can choose to make your unarmed strike deal force damage instead of bludgeoning damage, and any creature hit by your unarmed strike is unable to regain hit points until the end of your next turn. If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by your unarmed strike, it instantly disintegrates into soul fumes, leaving behind any objects, clothing, or items on its person.

entries.name: Age
entries: Like other fungi, myconids reproduce by mundane sporing. They carefully control their spores' release to avoid overpopulation. Individual myconids can live to well over a century. After this time, the most elder myconids can live even longer, becoming a Soverign of one or more circles and living up to a century longer.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most often, myconids believe strongly in society and law. It is extremely uncommon for a myconid to directly harm any creature that does not mean it, or its circle, harm.

entries.name: Size
entries: Myconids are between 5 feet to 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Sun Sickness
entries: You become {@condition Poisoned} if you spend more than 1 minute in direct sunlight. This condition ends when you spend more than 1 minute in dim or dark conditions.

entries.name: Without a Voice
entries: Myconids lack proper biological constructs that can convey sound, and as such, they cannot speak language or interact verbally with other creatures. Though you have no conventional way to verbalize your thoughts, you may still cast spells that require verbal components.

entries.name: Rapport Spores
entries: Your spores can relay messages to you and to allies by sensing the synapses in a creature's mind. You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see, provided the creature is within a number of feet of you equal to 10 times your level. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

You can extend this benefit to a creature or multiple creatures as an action, allowing them to converse telepathically with you or with each other for a range of 15 feet. The creatures selected must have an Intelligence score of 2 or higher. Once the telepathic network is set up, said creatures do not need to share a language in order for them to understand each other's telepathic utterances, but they each must be able to understand at least one language.

entries.name: Pacifying Spores
entries: As an action, you can ejects spores at one creature you can see within 5 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or become {@condition Charmed} for 1 minute. Undead, constructs, and elementals are unaffected by these spores. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After using this trait, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Hallucination Spores
entries: As an action, you can produce spores that effect all creatures within 30 feet of you that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. These creatures are all affected as per the cantrip {@spell minor illusion} while you concentrate on the effect. If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence saving throw equal to 8 + your Intelligence modifier + your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Rejuvenating Spores
entries: As an action, you can disect the body of a deceased individual who died within the last hour in front of you taking that is not an undead, construct, or elemental. This process takes one minute and requires serene concentration, the completion of which produces a spore which you can give to yourself or an ally within 5 feet of you.
Upon receiving a spore, the creature receives {@dice 1d10} temporary hit points, and the body you were disecting decays into a fine yellow powder.

entries.name: Meld
entries: When you take a short or long rest in the presence of one or more other myconids, you can meld with them. After melding, you regain all expended Hit Dice and gain one of the following benefits:
• You gain advantage on the next saving throw you make.
• You can end one effect causing you to be {@condition Blinded}, {@condition Deafened}, {@condition Paralyzed}, or {@condition Poisoned}.
• You can roll an additional 1d4 and add the number rolled to one ability check or attack roll you make.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can read and write Common and one extra language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Aarakockra tend to grow up very fast, reaching adulthood at the age of 14 and living up to 70 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most aarakocra are good and rarely choose sides when it comes to law and chaos. Tribal leaders and warriors might be lawful, while explorers and adventurers might tend toward chaotic

entries.name: Size
entries: Aarakocra are about 5 feet tall. They have thin, lightweight bodies that weigh between 80 and 100 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Aerial Vault
entries: You gain a flying speed of 40 feet while you aren't wearing medium or heavy armor. You fall if you end your turn in the air.

entries.name: Peak Dwellers
entries: You're acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet. You're also naturally adapted to strong wind and cold environments, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

entries.name: Intimidating Plummage
entries: As a bonus action you can double your proficiency bonus on any {@skill Intimidation} skill check. After using this ability, you can't use it again until after a short or long rest.

entries.name: Talons
entries: You are proficient with your unarmed strikes, which deal {@dice 1d6} slashing damage on a hit.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Aarakocra, and Auran.
